page.title: 01BARNACK AREA:AN INTRODUCTION
page.content: This area is a farming area growing barley,wheat and oil seed rape.There are a few pasture fields and some for potatoes,beans etc.There are two villages, Barnack and Pilsgate.Barnack has a Church and a Methodist chapel. The church is made of Barnack Ragstone from the Hills and Holes quarry once famous.Nearby there is a new housing estate and above this is the Cricket Club.Pilsgate is a hamlet near to Stamford.It has one farm.The farmers rent a lot of land from the two main estates Walcot and Burghley.The block has much natural beauty and is a conservation area.Being adjacent to Wittering airfield the peacefulness of the area is often shattered by Harriers overflying.Shopping and business takes place outside the block in Peterborough or Stamford.
